questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A company needs test scripts that can be leveraged by the Regression Suite Automated Testing (RSAT) tool. Several users are creating their test cases and sending the files to you to upload.
You need to create these scripts and link them to the RSAT tool.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: The correct sequence of actions is: 1, 3, and 4

Save recordings as .axtr files When you are done creating or editing a task recording, you are presented with several options for how you want to download, or save the recording. You can download the file as a task recording package (.axtr), download it as a raw recording file (.xml), download it as a Word document, or save the file to an LCS library. It is a good idea to always save your task recording as a task recording package file (.axtr). This will help make maintenance of the file easier if procedures or annotations need to change later. If you want to download the file as a Word document, also save it as a task recording package file.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/user-interface/task-recorder-training-docs
AXTR for BPM and XML for developers... there are two ways to save the recording.

comments.content: Actually task recoring files are AXTR. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/user-interface/task-recorder-training-docs

discussion.content: 1st one should be XML file, task recording files are XML not AXTR
Correct

SO:
Business Requrement
Test Scripts
Test Scripts
Business Requrement

comments.content: Pretty sure number 3 is Business Requirement....Use Cases are different than test cases...read people!!....... https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-plan-implementation-finance-operations/11-requirements

discussion.content: I think "Generate from the analysis meetings" should be business requirements

1 = BR
2 = TS
3 = BR
4 = BR
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/perf-test/rsat/rsat-overview

1. Generate from the analysis meetings - Business requirements
Test scripts are created in the design and develop phase therefore are not generated from the analysis meetings
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-plan-implementation-finance-operations/4-cloud-impl-design-and-develop
2. Use for regression testing - Test scripts
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-plan-implementation-finance-operations/5-cloud-impl-test
3. Generate use cases - Business requirements
A requirement is a series of activities, or steps within a subprocess. Organizations may leverage use case scenarios to explain the requirements clearly.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-plan-implementation-finance-operations/11-requirements
4. Use in gap analysis process - Business requirements
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/design-plan-implementation-finance-operations/3-cloud-impl-analysis

Correct answer is 
Business Requrement
Test Scripts
Test Scripts
Business Requrement

Correct sequence
BR
TS
TS
BR
Your answer is misguiding... could you please elaborate how and using which tool can we generate 'test script' from business analysis meeting?

The answer is correct: TS, TS, BR, BR.
Generating test scripts is one of the purposes of an analysis meeting.
Defining use cases is a business requirement not related directly to test scripts.

Correct sequence
BR
TS
TS
BR

Business Requirement
Test Scripts
Test Scripts
Business Requirement
Correct: Business Requirement, Test Script, Test Script, Business Requirement
Generate use cases should be Test scripts
Agree that Generate from analysis meeting should be Business requirements and Generate use cases should be Test scripts.
Generate use cases should be Test scripts

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are a Dynamics 365 Finance implementation consultant.
You plan to use automated regression testing in a company's environment, as the system will be updated frequently until automatic updates can be applied.
You need to identify when and what key business object should be used during the implementation.
Which business objects should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate objects to the correct component actions. Each object may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

You are Dynamics 365 Finance system administrator for a new implementation.
You have a solution that needs to be tested using User Acceptance Testing (UAT). You have created a Business process modeler (BPM) library.
You need to validate and support the solution.
Which three actions should you perform? Each answer presents part of the solution.

choices.A: Create a new Business process library.
choices.C: Upload the saved recording to BPM.
choices.B: Record test cases and save them to BPM.
choices.D: Create and save a new task recording.
choices.E: Export the task recording to Microsoft Word and upload it to BPM.

discussion.content: answer is correct. we have already the library.
in the question, it was stated that business process modeller was already created, which makes A unnecessary

Selected Answer: BCD
Correct!

Selected Answer: BCD
Answer is correct. Essentially, there are 2 ways how you can get task recording to BPM:
1. Save it to BPM (answer B)
2. Save it locally as .axtr file and upload it to BPM (answers C and D)
this question is a shit of MB-300

Selected Answer: BCD
Correct
BCD correct here
Aanswer is A D E
ACD https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/learn/modules/perform-uat-finance-operations/7-exercise

Answers seems correct. As solution has to be tested using BPM. And for testing, recordings have to be incorporated to BPM. We have obvious three methods to input recordings to BPM:

B. Record test cases and save them to BPM.
C. Upload the saved recording to BPM.
D. Create and save a new task recording.

Remember the qsn says: AFTER you have already created the BPM library - making A incorrect

the given answer is correct

comments.content: So? The exam gave you a clue that A was correct? the question wants us that after creating a BPM which steps should apply.

discussion.content: Correct answers are A C D, I got this quesiton on exam

I think that C & D are some how equal to B.
Hence, I think correct answer is: C,D,E

comments.content: hhmmm ya it does say SUPPORT the solution.. might be CDE
nope, you can create a new recording or uploading an existing one

discussion.content: B & C are almost the same. Should be A.C. & D.

Correct link:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/lifecycle-services/restart-environment-services
Correct
Should be done from LCS. Since its Tier 2+ env

comments.content:
exactly, if you check the link in the comment above, you'll see that is the "Step 0":
0 - in LCS
1-2 - on the (appropriate) environment details page
3 - select Maintain > Restart service

discussion.content: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/deployment/maintenanceoperationsguide-newinfrastructure#:~:text=Restart%20services,-You%20can%20use&text=In%20Microsoft%20Dynamics%20Lifecycle%20Services,restart%2C%20and%20then%20select%20Confirm.

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You sign in to Lifecycle Services (LCS).
You need to restart the Internet Information Service (IIS) service in a nonproduction Tier 2 environment.
Which three actions should you perform in sequence? To answer, move the appropriate actions from the list of actions to the answer area and arrange them in the correct order.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Agreed

questions.question_text:
A company implements Dynamics 365 Finance.
The implementation team must build acceptance testing scripts to make sure that common business use cases can be performed in the new system. They must use cases by stepping through required tasks, organized by functional hierarchy.
You need to create User Acceptance Testing (UAT) tests in Lifecycle Services (LCS) that can be easily repeatable.
What should you use?
